page.title: 01Landscape,Scoutmoor,Pennines
page.content:
General Review
Our 12 sq. km. consists of part of the Pennine Uplands called{ Scout Moor.}An area of rugged moorland,steep slopes,deeply dissected valleys and table-like hill tops.Parts of {Shuttleworth} and{Edenfield}village in the extreme west of our block,together with{Turn}village are the only areas of settlement,except for scattered and isolated farms.The area is used for sheep farming,although many of the farms are either derelict or have developed different functions. {Whittle Hill}at 468m.is the highest point.Below this,Scout Moor quarries have recently been opened providing building materials of grit and sandstone.
